sections.title: Critical safety alert
sections.content:
Critical fluid and electrolyte imbalances require immediate medical intervention. Select emergency type for step-by-step professional protocols.

Severe electrolyte imbalances can cause cardiac arrest within minutes. Immediate intervention and continuous monitoring required.

steps.title: Immediate Safety Assessment
steps.subtitle: Ensure scene safety. Rapidly assess airway, breathing, circulation. Check mental status and vital signs.

steps.title: Calculate Fluid Deficit
steps.subtitle: Assess dehydration severity: Mild (3–5%), Moderate (6–9%), Severe (>10%). Calculate deficit: % dehydration × weight (kg) × 10mL.

steps.title: Establish IV Access
steps.subtitle: Obtain large bore IV access (16–18G if possible). Consider two large bore IVs for severe dehydration.

steps.title: Initial Fluid Resuscitation
steps.subtitle: Adults: 500–1000ml NS bolus over 15–30 min. Pediatric: 20ml/kg NS bolus over 20 min. Reassess after each bolus.

steps.title: Monitor Response
steps.subtitle: Assess improvement in BP, HR, mental status, urine output. May repeat bolus 2–3 times if needed.

steps.title: Immediate Cardiac Assessment
steps.subtitle: Obtain 12-lead ECG immediately. Look for peaked T waves, wide QRS, sine wave pattern. Continuous cardiac monitoring.

steps.title: Cardiac Membrane Stabilization
steps.subtitle: If K+ > 6.5 mEq/L or ECG changes: Calcium gluconate 1–2g (10–20mL of 10%) IV over 5–10 minutes. May repeat once.

steps.title: Shift Potassium Intracellularly
steps.subtitle: Insulin 10 units + D50W 25g IV. Albuterol 10–20mg nebulized. Sodium bicarbonate 50mEq IV if acidotic.

steps.title: Remove Potassium
steps.subtitle: Kayexalate 15–30g PO/PR. Furosemide 40–80mg IV if not volume depleted. Consider dialysis for refractory cases.

steps.title: Monitor and Reassess
steps.subtitle: Recheck K+ in 1–2 hours. Monitor glucose q30min × 4 hours. Continuous cardiac monitoring.

steps.title: Stay Calm
steps.subtitle: Take a deep breath and assess the situation calmly.

steps.title: Call Emergency Service
steps.subtitle: Call emergency services and provide clear information about the emergency.

steps.title: Provide Information
steps.subtitle: Give your exact location, nature of emergency, and number of people involved.

steps.title: Safety & De-escalation
steps.subtitle: Ensure scene safety. Use calm, non-confrontational approach. Assess for agitation, psychosis, or disorientation.

steps.title: Mental Status Assessment
steps.subtitle: Assess orientation, thought process, perceptions. Look for hallucinations, delusions, or command voices.

steps.title: Risk Assessment
steps.subtitle: Evaluate risk to self and others. Assess need for involuntary treatment. Consider substance use influence.

steps.title: Treatment Planning
steps.subtitle: Consider medication for severe agitation. Plan for psychiatric evaluation and appropriate disposition.
